intro: Hovea beckeri, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hovea, is a small evergreen shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often pubescent. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense spikes, and it produces flat, leathery pods that contain several seeds. Hovea beckeri is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and semi-arid regions.
